function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Statistically nonsignificant results for certain health outcomes","Impact":"Inaccurate or inconclusive findings may lead to misguided interventions or policies.","Mitigation":"Increase sample size, improve study design, and use rigorous statistical analysis methods.","Technologies":"Advanced statistical modeling, machine learning, and data analytics.","People":"Researchers, policymakers, and public health officials","Owner":"Research institutions, government agencies, and public health organizations"},{"Description":"Substantial heterogeneity in study results","Impact":"Difficulty in generalizing findings and identifying effective interventions for the population.","Mitigation":"Conduct subgroup analysis, improve study design, and use standardized measurement tools.","Technologies":"Data visualization, statistical software, and machine learning algorithms.","People":"Epidemiologists, statisticians, and public health researchers","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations, and funding agencies"},{"Description":"Inclusion of poor quality studies in the meta-analysis","Impact":"Overestimation or underestimation of treatment effects and increased uncertainty in the findings.","Mitigation":"Implement strict inclusion criteria, conduct sensitivity analysis, and use robust quality assessment tools.","Technologies":"Quality assessment tools, machine learning algorithms for bias detection, and data validation techniques.","People":"Meta-analysts, systematic reviewers, and research methodologists","Owner":"Research institutions, academic journals, and regulatory agencies"}]}
